intro: Erica hispiduloides, commonly known as the woolly heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, shrub-like form and small, needle-like leaves covered in fine, white hairs. Erica hispiduloides produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late summer. It is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
